result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javon Aaron Robinson

Defendant Javon Aaron Robinson in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Javon Aaron Robinson.  Attorney Michael Lonski for Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Final pre-trial scheduled for March 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for April 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Javon Aaron Robinson in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Javon Aaron Robinson.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense has received discovery but no offer and requests additional time to review.  Court grants request.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.  bm

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Brostrom.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Borowski, Br. 12.

Defendant Javon Aaron Robinson in court by video with Attorney James Edgar Toran who appears in person.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Robinson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Javon Aaron Robinson in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense is newly retained and would like additional time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for cause for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
